q:
Consider the following example of a base component in the JES scheduler services of z/OS. These services have assigned the IEF prefix for its modules and messages. Determine the value of C and n.

Example

IEF097I jobname USER userid ASSIGNED

In Mainframe, which of these ISPF and TSO commands can be used to perform the following actions:

  1. Convert block to lowercase
  2. Invoke link prompter and linkage editor

If you want a system with the following specifications, then which of these types of mainframe processings can be used:

Tasks

  1. It has a control region that controls the traffic in and out of the system.
  2. It separates the data layers from the presentation layer.
In Mainframe, which of the following tasks can be used to arrange the processes in a queue and control the initiators during batch processing?

In z/OS, the following unique message format is used by both the base component and optional software components. Which of these options indicate the severity level and the uniquely assigned message identifier number in this message?

Unique message

id CCCnnnnns text

a.option:
Severity level: s
Message identifier: nn

Severity level: s
Message identifier: id

Severity level: s
Message identifier: nnnnn

Severity level: nnnnn
Message identifier: CCC

q: In TSO, which of the following Foreground Initiated Background (FIB) commands provides a direct output medium for the background job?

In Mainframe, in which of the following situations can online processing be used: 

  1. Production scheduling
  2. Inventory control
  3. Production control

In Mainframe, which of the following statements about disk drives is incorrect:

  1. Direct Access Storage Device (DASD) is another name for a disk drive.
  2. A disk drive contains cylinders.
  3. Data blocks are the units of recordings on the cylinder tracks.

In Mainframe, the following MVS system command is used to specify when the SDUMP data capture process must stop. Which of these situations occurs if the command is set to the ON state?

MVS system command

SDUMP,AUXMGMT

a.option: No new dumps are allowed when auxiliary storage usage reaches 50%
No new dumps are allowed when auxiliary storage usage reaches 30%
No new dumps are allowed when auxiliary storage usage reaches 20%
New dumps are allowed when auxiliary storage usage reaches 50%

q: In Mainframe, if you want to create an interactive session for a user, then which of the following environments can be used?

In Mainframe, which of the following statements about the addition of the JCL data to the data set in LRECL= 80 is correct:

  1. You can use the GUI screen of an application to add JCL.
  2. You can use DTL to add JCL.
  3. You can use the ISPF panel to add JCL.

In COBOL, you are using the following TSO session. If you want to classify the session to a service class, then which of these parameters can be specified on an EXEC statement:

TSO session

fine
In TSO/E, which of the following command operands can be used to start a session program for production using the MSSERV command?

In z/OS, if you want to specify the Graphical Data Display Manager (GDDM) graphic print parameter while working with TSO/E, then which of the following values must be specified to the ISPF parameters?

In COBOL, you are working on z/OS version 2 release 3. If you are using the ALLOCATE command, then which of the following operands can be used to reallocate the DDNAME parameter to a specified data set?
